title: Murder probe over Cumbernauld shopping centre attack
article: Police have launched a murder investigation after a man was fatally injured outside a shopping centre in North Lanarkshire. James Ross, 27, was seriously hurt during a disturbance at the back of the Abronhill Shopping Centre on Pine Road, Cumbernauld, at about 16:40 on Monday. He was pronounced dead a short time later at a property on nearby Larch Court. A 15-year-old boy has been arrested over the death. Det Ch Insp Kevin Houliston said inquiries were ongoing and urged anyone who was near the shopping centre at the time to contact police via thenon-emergency line . He said: "Our thoughts are with James's family and friends. We are providing his family with support at this difficult time. "I would also urge anyone with any other information at all which could help our inquiries to get in touch as soon as you can."
